Package xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates

The package xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates provides implementations of the techniques proposed in [HHW97]: J.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
OnlineAggregation This class provides an interface for online aggregation functions.
ReservoirSample.ReservoirSamplingStrategy Interface providing a strategy for reservoir sampling techniques.
 

Class Summary
Average Estimates iteratively the average of given numerical data without any error control.
ConfidenceAggregationFunction In the context of online aggregation aggregates are iteratively computed.
Count Computes iteratively the number of given objects that are not null.
CountAll Counts iteratively the number of given objects (inclusive null-objects).
CountAwareAverage Provides the same functionality as Average but keeps the count information.
FourthCentralMomentEstimator Estimates iteratively the fourth central moment of given numerical data without any error control.
LastN Stores the last 'seen' n objects.
LastNthAverage Computes the average of the n last seen numbers without any error control.
Maximum Computes the maximum of given data without any error control wrt.
Minimum Computes the minimum of given data without any error control wrt.
NumberOfRuns Computes the number of runs in a given sequence with respect to an ordering imposed by a comparator.
NumericalAggregateND This class combines a given number of aggregate functions for numerical data to process data of type double [] with aggregate functions consuming objects of type number in one pass.
ReservoirSample This class provides sampling algorithms for the usage with the aggregator cursor.
ReservoirSample.AbstractStrategy This class provides a preimplementation of the ReservoirSamplingStrategy interface to minimize the effort required to implement this interface.
ReservoirSample.RType Type R strategy computes for every object of the underlying iterator the designated position in the reservoir.
ReservoirSample.XType Type X strategy computes first the number of objects to skip and then the position in the reservoir for the object followed by the last one skipped.
ReservoirSample.ZType Type Z strategy computes first the number of objects to skip and then the position in the reservoir for the object followed by the last one skipped.
StandardDeviation Computes the standard deviation step-by-step on numerical data without any error control using Variance.
StandardDeviationEstimator Computes an estimation of the standard deviation step-by-step on numerical data without any error control using VarianceEstimator.
Sum Computes iteratively the sum of given numerical data without any error control.
SumEstimator This class provides an estimator for the aggregation function SUM.
ThirdCentralMomentEstimator Estimates iteratively the third central moment of given numerical data without any error control.
Variance Computes the variance in a recursive manner using an algorithm based upon [Wes79]: D.H.D.
VarianceEstimator Computes an estimation of the variance (in this case the sample variance) in a recursive manner using an algorithm based upon [Wes79]: D.H.D.
 

Package xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates Description

The package xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates provides implementations of the techniques proposed in [HHW97]: J. Hellerstein, P. Haas, and H. Wang, 1997. There, parametric estimators are computed online over a data stream and in some cases they are even equipped with the according confidence intervals. The online computation of the aggregation functions relies on the aggregator cursor. An aggregate is computed by an aggregation function inductively with agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next). This means an aggregation function must be a two-figured function expecting as first argument the previous computed aggregation value and as second argument the next object to use for computation.
